full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Title
Construction of Marine Infrastructure for Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Marine Operations – Victoria, BC

#### Tender Reference
WS3915902835


#### Overview
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is issuing an Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) for the Construction of Marine Infrastructure for Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Marine Operations in Victoria, British Columbia.

#### Procurement Details
* **Amendment**: This tender has not undergone any modifications.
* **Solicitation Number**: WS3915902835
* **Publication Date**: March 14, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: April 5, 2023
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: May 15, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: None
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive – Open Bidding
* **Notice of Interest**: The ITQ will be used to establish a standing offer for the designated commodities or services.

#### Technical Requirements
* **Industry Classification**: Infrastructure maintenance and repair services, Marine construction services, Concrete installation and repair services, Service station equipment installation and maintenance services, and Heavy equipment installation and maintenance services (UNSPOC codes 72103300, 72141200, 72152700, 72153300, and 72154500)
* **Place of Delivery**: British Columbia

#### Contracting Entity Details
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contracting Entity Address**: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5, Canada

#### Respondent Information
* **Point of Contact**: Ngan, Ken (SPAC/PSPC) (he/him)
* **Contact Email**: ken.ngan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Notice URL**: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15695871?extsite=MTU2OTU4NzFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note: Changes made to the original document mostly concerned with filtering out unnecessary information, providing clear headings, rephrasing certain areas for readability, and moving related information together for ease of reference. There are some reorganizations for conciseness and professional tone while maintaining the original message and required details. The
